ConsumerBaseFoundation.stf_description: In Australia Christmas and New Years Eve fall when summer is in full-swing.
ConsumerBaseFoundation.stf_ImageLocation: Sydney Harbour, Sydney, NSW. © Destination NSW & Hamilton Lund
ConsumerBaseFoundation.txt_Teaser: In Australia Christmas and New Year's Eve fall when summer is in full-swing.

TopCategoryHighlights.txt_Information:
National
December

In Australia Christmas and New Year's Eve fall when summer is in full-swing. Festivities abound, including carol singing in city parks, thrilling sporting competitions, vibrant outdoor celebrations and world-class cultural events. All around the country there are a variety of ways to experience the Australian lifestyle and meet the locals. Sydney dazzles with its world-class event and a spectacular midnight fireworks display off the Sydney Harbour Bridge. There are riverside parties in Melbourne and Brisbane; and parties in the park in Perth and Adelaide. In Hobart welcome the Sydney to Hobart yacht racers with fireworks on the historic waterfront.

In Australia Christmas and New Year's Eve fall when summer is in full-swing. Festivities abound, including carol singing in city parks, thrilling sporting competitions, vibrant outdoor celebrations and world-class cultural events. All around the country there are a variety of ways to experience the Australian lifestyle and meet the locals.

Sydney Harbour is one of the most spectacular places to welcome in the New Year. More than one million people join in the celebrations and it is one of the largest free public events in the world. There are many vantage points along the 65 kilometres of foreshore for people to gather with friends and family. In the final seconds before midnight on 31 December, Sydney becomes the New Year's Eve capital of the world as the Sydney Harbour Bridge lights up in a dazzling fireworks display that is broadcast to billions around the world.

There are also spectacular fireworks in Melbourne with free celebrations along the Yarra River. Join the huge party in the centre of the action at Federation Square or mingle with the roving performers and exuberant crowds along Southgate Promenade.

Brisbane brings the new year in with a bang at South Bank parklands, the venue for live music, an all-ages dance party, free movies, a fairground and two spectacular fireworks displays over the Brisbane River.

Adelaide's Elder Park also comes live with dazzling fireworks off Victoria Bridge. New year’s celebrations are also held in the pretty port of Victor Harbor, south of Adelaide, and the seaside town of Beachport, on the Limestone Coast in the state's south-east.

Western Australia farewells the old year with free entertainment at Perth’s street party in Northbridge. The centre of the city is transformed into a family-friendly pedestrian mall with al fresco dining and roving street performers.

People from all around the world join the party at Sullivans Cove, on Hobart’s historic waterfront to cheer the new year with crews from the Sydney to Hobart yacht race. In Canberra, Australia’s national capital, the action includes free music concerts, dance parties, picnics in the park and fireworks over Lake Burley Griffin. Darwin’s Wharf Precinct forms the hub of a number of celebrations. Make the most of the tropical weather with your last meal of the year in one of the many al fresco eateries. Enjoy live music, family entertainment and street theatre. Watch magnificent fireworks illuminate Darwin’s harbour on the Timor Sea.

PlanYourVisit.stf_DomesticRegion: Melbourne; Greater Sydney; Hobart and surrounds; Adelaide; Experience Perth; Darwin and Surrounds; brisbane region;
